text:
looking at this in the dev console, it's coming from an HTML file for the "EN" language.

Are you able to find this file in Design Tools?

Hi <@U03AKL6Q1B2>, that’s the thing. All theses styles get generated by the page-editor – it is not coming from the template at all – and for sure not visible within Design Tools.
It is normal that styles are added - as pages are built to allow setting of padding, background-color and margin on various dnd-levels (if section, column, row or module).
In the other Accounts I know & checked the class is never called ‘background-layers’ but ‘background’ oder ‘gradient’ – with according proper styling.
But on this one when selecting a simple Background-Color the background image set – which shouldn’t be the case (in my opinion).

Example:
Setting the background-color to `#dbf2d7` on a dnd-section creates the (wrong) styling:
```background-image: linear-gradient(rgba(219, 242, 215, 1), rgba(219, 242, 215, 1)) !important;
background-position: left top !important;```

my point is: there shouldn’t be a background-image - but a plain background-color generated. It was like that priorly (but it seems it this changed recently - and I wonder why, as it doesn’t make any sense!).

Previously it WAS styled like:
```background-color:rgba(219, 242, 215, 1)!important;```
Can you check the _layouts.css to see if they are added there?

It is possible to preset options for the DND areas within your theme, this is not a global change that I can find in any of the themes or accounts I have access to (hundreds) so it has to be local to your theme files
regardig _layouts.css: this contains plainly only the layout-related styling for the grid-system as it is required for HubSpot (for `row-fluid` and `span1`-`span12` ).

regarding options: I did not add any options. These are all options which are available by default for the editor of a page.
I wouldn’t know how to add/remove entries there (except on module-level).
does your theme have a _containers-dnd.css? this is also a common place where I've seen dnd section defaults being preset
For example, this theme is presetting an 80 px padding on sections, the same can be done for background colors/images, etc. which would set defaults in the page editor

Hi, yep the theme does contain a _container-dnd.css - with mostly very basic stuffe - with some spacings there tied to settings of the theme.
Yet nothing which I would remotely connect to the issue at hand.
I also couldn't find the specific CSS file in the dev tool, all of the styles are directly in that /en HTML template

Yep, these are all styles which the HubSpot-Editor generates (depending on the interaction of the Page-editing User).
All in all it is fine like that – yet what bugs me is the incorrect use of attributes (especially as it was different just a week ago).
There is also no documentation or anything to be found – which would provide reasoning for this (sudden) change.

That's really strange, if you download a free theme from the marketplace and build a test page, can you check if this is still happening?

It's definitely isolated to your HS account, I wonder if it's the theme or something else triggering this
